description.narrative: This project will work in 52 communities in three municipalties – Chajul, Cotzal and Nebaj – in the department of Quiché. The project will benefit 1800 members of 300 families with food security interventions and 900 additional coffee farmers with interventions targeted at improving coffee productivity, for a total of 2700 direct beneficiaries (1725M, 975F) and 4500 indirect beneficiaries (1875M, 2625F). Participating families will directly benefit from: Improved resilience in their coffee plantations through the use of efficient microorganisms (EM), disease resistant varieties, soil conservation practices, and other best practices promoted using a farmer to farmer methodology which will be enriched through the project with the introduction of cellphones to augment farmer exchanges. Increased household food security through support for highly productive household gardens and poultry raising for consumption and sale, and strengthened community self help systems through use of passing on the gift for distributing poultry and other resources, as well as savings groups to support access to water filters and improved stoves.
